name: histiocytic and dendritic cell cancer
definition: A sarcoma and hematologic cancer that derives_from follicular lymphoma. [url:http\://www.springerlink.com/content/h9wrn7p72x26q035/]

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a clinical case study, Xalkori (crizotinib) treatment resulted in a decrease in tumor volume by more than 60% in a patient with histiocytic sarcoma harboring MET exon 14 skipping and TP53 R175H (PMID: 25971938).

references.title: Activation of MET via diverse exon 14 splicing alterations occurs in multiple tumor types and confers clinical sensitivity to MET inhibitors.

clinicalTrials.title: A Phase 2 Study of Pembrolizumab in Patients With Histiocyte/Dendritic Cell Neoplasms and Biologically Selected Subtypes of Relapsed/Refractory Aggressive Lymphomas
Ulixertinib in Treating Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors, Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma, or Histiocytic Disorders With MAPK Pathway Mutations (A Pediatric MATCH Treatment Trial)
